briefdescription.para: Creates a new auth conversation object for the server side.

detaileddescription.para: See http://dbus.freedesktop.org/doc/dbus-specification.html#auth-protocol for full details on what this object does.

simplesect.para: the new object or NULL if no memory

briefdescription.para: Creates a new auth conversation object for the client side.

detaileddescription.para: See http://dbus.freedesktop.org/doc/dbus-specification.html#auth-protocol for full details on what this object does.

simplesect.para: the new object or NULL if no memory

briefdescription.para: Increments the refcount of an auth object.
Decrements the refcount of an auth object.
Sets an array of authentication mechanism names that we are willing to use.
Analyzes buffered input and moves the auth conversation forward, returning the new state of the auth conversation.
Gets bytes that need to be sent to the peer we're conversing with.

detaileddescription.para: After writing some bytes, _dbus_auth_bytes_sent() must be called to notify the auth object that they were written.

parameterdescription.para: return location for a ref to the buffer to send

briefdescription.para: Notifies the auth conversation object that the given number of bytes of the outgoing buffer have been written out.
Get a buffer to be used for reading bytes from the peer we're conversing with.

detaileddescription.para: Bytes should be appended to this buffer.

parameterdescription.para: return location for buffer to append bytes to

briefdescription.para: Returns a buffer with new data read into it.
Returns leftover bytes that were not used as part of the auth conversation.

detaileddescription.para: These bytes will be part of the message stream instead. This function may not be called until authentication has succeeded.

parameterdescription.para: return location for pointer to string of unused bytes

briefdescription.para: Gets rid of unused bytes returned by _dbus_auth_get_unused_bytes() after we've gotten them and successfully moved them elsewhere.
Called post-authentication, indicates whether we need to encode the message stream with _dbus_auth_encode_data() prior to sending it to the peer.

simplesect.para: TRUE if we need to encode the stream

briefdescription.para: Called post-authentication, encodes a block of bytes for sending to the peer.

detaileddescription.para: If no encoding was negotiated, just copies the bytes (you can avoid this by checking _dbus_auth_needs_encoding()).

parameterdescription.para: initialized string to where encoded data is appended

simplesect.para: TRUE if we had enough memory and successfully encoded

briefdescription.para: Called post-authentication, indicates whether we need to decode the message stream with _dbus_auth_decode_data() after receiving it from the peer.

simplesect.para: TRUE if we need to encode the stream

briefdescription.para: Called post-authentication, decodes a block of bytes received from the peer.

detaileddescription.para: If no encoding was negotiated, just copies the bytes (you can avoid this by checking _dbus_auth_needs_decoding()).

xrefdescription.para: 1.0? We need to be able to distinguish "out of memory" error from "the data is hosed" error.

parameterdescription.para: initialized string where decoded data is appended

simplesect.para: TRUE if we had enough memory and successfully decoded

briefdescription.para: Sets credentials received via reliable means from the operating system.
Gets the identity we authorized the client as.

detaileddescription.para: Apps may have different policies as to what identities they allow.
Returned credentials are not a copy and should not be modified

simplesect.para: the credentials we've authorized BY REFERENCE do not modify

briefdescription.para: Gets the GUID from the server if we've authenticated; gets NULL otherwise.

simplesect.para: the GUID in ASCII hex format

briefdescription.para: Sets the "authentication context" which scopes cookies with the DBUS_COOKIE_SHA1 auth mechanism for example.
Sets whether unix fd passing is potentially on the transport and hence shall be negotiated.

parameterdescription.para: TRUE when unix fd passing shall be negotiated, otherwise FALSE

briefdescription.para: Queries whether unix fd passing was successfully negotiated.

simplesect.para: TRUE when unix fd passing was negotiated.
TRUE if we're in a final state

briefdescription.para: DBusAuth object.

detaileddescription.para: DBusAuth manages the authentication negotiation when a connection is first established, and also manages any encryption used over a connection.

xrefdescription.para: some SASL profiles require sending the empty string as a challenge/response, but we don't currently allow that in our protocol.
right now sometimes both ends will block waiting for input from the other end, e.g. if there's an error during DBUS_COOKIE_SHA1.
the cookie keyring needs to be cached globally not just per-auth (which raises threadsafety issues too)
